title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 76.14 - High cost areas
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 76.14 - High cost areas

State Regulations

The Banking Department recognizes that the demographics and
housing characteristics of an area may be such that the gap between housing
costs and area median income greatly restricts the affordability of
owner-occupied housing for low-and moderate-income persons residing in such an
area. At the same time, there may exist a shortage of credit which endangers
the preservation, stabilization or improvement of middle-income geographies or
limits access to credit for middle- income persons residing in such an area. Where, based on relevant, current and verifiable data (including but not
limited to the most recent census data pertaining to such area) these
conditions are found to exist, the department may, in its assessment of the
institution's performance, be flexible in its consideration of a banking
institution's activities pertaining to owner-occupied housing in middle-income
geographies or for middle-income individuals residing in such an area. Consideration of such activities shall be in addition to, and not in lieu of, consideration of activities in low-or moderate-income geographies and
activities which serve low- or moderate- income individuals. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3
ยง
76.14

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
